cobblemon.species.bouwee.name: Bouwee
cobblemon.species.bouwee.desc: Bouwee's tail lets it drift peacefully near the surface. However, the bright colors often attract predators, so it will release a jet of water to escape.
cobblemon.species.scubug.name: Scubug
cobblemon.species.scubug.desc: Scubug's sturdy exoskeleton protects it from crushing deep sea pressure. Its antennae emit powerful light that allows it to navigate the darkest depths.
cobblemon.species.totter.name: Totter
cobblemon.species.totter.desc: Totters skin requires constant moisture, so it makes its home near riverbanks. It likes to soak up water with its tail and splash other Pokémon with it.
cobblemon.species.cascotta.name: Cascotta
cobblemon.species.cascotta.desc: Wild Cascotta have been known to attract attention by leaping out of streams and performing displays of aerial acrobatics at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.lutrajet.name: Lutrajet
cobblemon.species.lutrajet.desc: Dwelling in the deepest reaches of the clearest pools, Lutrajet moves as if it were one with the water. There are few who have witnessed this elegant dance.
cobblemon.species.alpint.name: Alpint
cobblemon.species.alpint.desc: The sapling at the end of its trunk acts as a personal weathervane. By holding it up to the wind, Alpint can tell where the weather will be most favorable.
cobblemon.species.forusk.name: Forusk
cobblemon.species.forusk.desc: While normally peaceful when soaking up sunlight, Forusk is quick to anger if approached. It swings its hammer-like trunk with enough force to level houses.
cobblemon.species.platypow.name: Platypow
cobblemon.species.platypow.desc: Predators that dont pay heed to Platypow because of its tiny size are quickly surprised by its fiery nature and its remarkably strong punches.
cobblemon.species.platikhao.name: Platikhao
cobblemon.species.platikhao.desc: Platikhao has venomous barbs hidden on its elbows and knees. It uses them to hurl furious strikes against its foes, and then lets the poison do its work.
cobblemon.species.cuppy.name: Cuppy
cobblemon.species.cuppy.desc: Schools of Cuppy gather in circles when sleeping, burying their noses in the sea bed. Many poems have been written about these strange underwater tea parties.
cobblemon.species.fettlekish.name: Fettlekish
cobblemon.species.fettlekish.desc: Fettlekish stores water in its body and controls its temperature to let it sink or float underwater. It can also release the water in a scalding hot blast.
cobblemon.species.shibalbat.name: Shibalbat
cobblemon.species.shibalbat.desc: Legend states that Shibalbat guards the entrance to the Underworld. It appears to be a statue until exposed to moonlight.
cobblemon.species.nobunata.name: Nobunata
cobblemon.species.nobunata.desc: Nobunata fights fearlessly and honorably, standing up for the weak and defenseless. When defeat seems inevitable, it will explode in a flurry of treats.
cobblemon.species.psybex.name: Psybex
cobblemon.species.psybex.desc: Psybex takes long journeys to mountain tops, searching for inner peace. Through meditation, it is able to see into the hearts of humans and Pokémon alike.
cobblemon.species.gnuru.name: Gnuru
cobblemon.species.gnuru.desc: Its horn amplifies its psychic powers, allowing Gnuru to communicate with parts unknown. It meditates daily to commune with these voices from afar.
cobblemon.species.flowger.name: Flowger
cobblemon.species.flowger.desc: When Flowger gather in great numbers, their songs form a joyous symphony. Many romantics believe that hearing a Flowger sing means one will find true love.
cobblemon.species.blue_flowger.name: Flowger
cobblemon.species.blue_flowger.desc1: When Flowger gather in great numbers, their songs form a joyous symphony. Many romantics believe that hearing a Flowger sing means one will find true love.
cobblemon.species.bullotus.name: Bullotus
cobblemon.species.bullotus.desc: Bullotuss booming cry can be heard for miles around. When resting, it floats on the water and looks up, absorbing sunlight with the petals around its neck.
cobblemon.species.blue_bullotus.name: Bullotus
cobblemon.species.blue_bullotus.desc1: Bullotuss booming cry can be heard for miles around. When resting, it floats on the water and looks up, absorbing sunlight with the petals around its neck.
cobblemon.species.burrowl.name: Burrowl
cobblemon.species.burrowl.desc: Burrowls heavy wings prevent it from flying, but it uses them as shovels to dig underground. It also uses its wings to protect small Pokémon from sandstorms.
cobblemon.species.magowl.name: Magowl
cobblemon.species.magowl.desc: Its wings are broad and powerful, yet it never flies. It is said that Magowl is weighed down by the arcane secrets hidden within its cloak of feathers.
cobblemon.species.craliber.name: Craliber
cobblemon.species.craliber.desc: Hatched near undersea mineral deposits, this Pokémon develops a sturdy shell. Its body rotates, helping it maintain course at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.crawglock.name: Crawglock
cobblemon.species.crawglock.desc: Crawglock hides underneath rocks to guard its offspring. A rapid click of its claws releases explosive blasts of heat and light with a loud bang.
cobblemon.species.leafish.name: Leafish
cobblemon.species.leafish.desc: When food is scarce, it floats sideways on the water's surface and absorbs sunlight for energy. Bug Pokémon often land on it, mistaking Leafish for a real leaf.
cobblemon.species.chlorofin.name: Chlorofin
cobblemon.species.chlorofin.desc: Chlorofin's natural camouflage makes it difficult to find in the wild, but once encountered, it'll display the playful, friendly attitude for which it's known.
cobblemon.species.quibble.name: Quibble
cobblemon.species.quibble.desc: Irascible and immature, Quibble squawks loudly when it doesn't get its way. It picks on smaller Pokémon but it's quick to flee when its targets fight back.
cobblemon.species.fowattle.name: Fowattle
cobblemon.species.fowattle.desc: As Fowattle grows bigger and bolder, it becomes somewhat of a bully. Rather than foraging on its own, it prefers to steal food from weaker Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.turkistador.name: Turkistador
cobblemon.species.turkistador.desc: Turkistador often moves into other Pokémon's nests, stubbornly refusing to leave until the old inhabitant gives up and flees.
cobblemon.species.sedirrot.name: Sedirrot
cobblemon.species.sedirrot.desc: Sedirrot cleaves chunks of stone and clay from cliffsides using its axe-like beak. The excavated minerals are then consumed to strengthen its rigid hide.
cobblemon.species.condesa.name: Condesa
cobblemon.species.condesa.desc: Condesa is known to make entire canyons its territory. It has been found to carve images of things it likes into cliffsides.
cobblemon.species.cardinite.name: Cardinite
cobblemon.species.cardinite.desc: Though it can fly, Cardinite prefers to chase its prey around on foot, where it is more comfortable. It leaves a trail of small, scorched tracks as it runs.
cobblemon.species.chardinal.name: Chardinal
cobblemon.species.chardinal.desc: Chardinal routinely sets its own nest on fire to keep the eggs at the right temperature. When it takes off, it looks like the blazing streak of a comet.
cobblemon.species.skurrow.name: Skurrow
cobblemon.species.skurrow.desc: Skurrow digs itself underground to find shelter from the desert heat in a series of tunnels. It hisses to alert other Skurrow when danger is approaching.
cobblemon.species.somberado.name: Somberado
cobblemon.species.somberado.desc: Legend has it that Somberado was born of souls that got lost in the vast emptiness of the desert. Now it is forced to wander the badlands endlessly.
cobblemon.species.phlask.name: Phlask
cobblemon.species.phlask.desc: Laboratory glassware possessed by a playful but frightening spirit. It is known to spew chemicals onto random objects to see what happens.
cobblemon.species.noxial.name: Noxial
cobblemon.species.noxial.desc: Noxial have been discovered in both endothermic and exothermic forms. The more extreme the temperature, the more volatile the Noxial.
cobblemon.species.exothermic_noxial.name: Noxial
cobblemon.species.exothermic_noxial.desc: Noxial have been discovered in both endothermic and exothermic forms. The more extreme the temperature, the more volatile the Noxial.
cobblemon.species.fumighast.name: Fumighast
cobblemon.species.fumighast.desc: Within Fumighast are residual chemicals from its time as a Noxial. Using them as catalysts, Fumighast can recreate spontaneous, volatile reactions at will.
cobblemon.species.atomite.name: Atomite
cobblemon.species.atomite.desc: Atomite is the smallest known Pokémon. Sometimes a big group of Atomite will group together to mimic the shape of something else.
cobblemon.species.orbatom.name: Orbatom
cobblemon.species.orbatom.desc: Orbatom is able to discern objects as small as subatomic particles. It has enabled scientists to understand nuclear physics at a fundamental level.
cobblemon.species.squink.name: Squink
cobblemon.species.squink.desc: When confronted, Squink sprays its foes with noxious black ink to escape. While toxic in high doses, it has a distinct flavor and is used in a variety of dishes.
cobblemon.species.squidrift.name: Squidrift
cobblemon.species.squidrift.desc: Squidrift is able to fly by expelling noxious gases at high pressure. Its tentacles are delicacies, but highly toxic if prepared incorrectly.
cobblemon.species.boarealis.name: Boarealis
cobblemon.species.boarealis.desc: Boarealis' psychic powers produce vivid light shows when they interact with magnetic fields. The brilliance of the mane indicates an individual's strength.
cobblemon.species.chelonite.name: Chelonite
cobblemon.species.chelonite.desc: Chelonite uses its psychic control over gravity to levitate itself above the ground. It will sometimes get confused which way is up and float upside-down.
cobblemon.species.galaxagos.name: Galaxagos
cobblemon.species.galaxagos.desc: Galaxagos shell is so dense, it exudes a gravitational pull. At night, Chelonite swarm around it, orbiting in a spiral pattern for safety.
cobblemon.species.magnitogre.name: Magnitogre
cobblemon.species.magnitogre.desc: Magnitogre was first discovered when factories became commonplace. It feeds on leftover industrial waste, providing a safe environment for other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.minarac.name: Minarac
cobblemon.species.minarac.desc: Minarac digs elaborate tunnels to confuse its prey. Its constant search for gemstones also makes it a valuable companion for treasure-hunters.
cobblemon.species.trenchula.name: Trenchula
cobblemon.species.trenchula.desc: Trenchula uses its powerful mandibles to drill into the earth, forming a pitfall trap to ensnare its prey. It often work alongside miners underground.
cobblemon.species.pottle.name: Pottle
cobblemon.species.pottle.desc: It deviously infiltrates homes and fools unwary humans into caring for it. If discovered, Pottle will resist removal by stubbornly rooting into place.
cobblemon.species.trikotta.name: Trikotta
cobblemon.species.trikotta.desc: Trikotta actively seeks out the soil with the most nutrients. It will uproot crops from farmland and then defend its stolen land against angered farmers.
cobblemon.species.terrorcotta.name: Terrorcotta
cobblemon.species.terrorcotta.desc: Terrorcotta is too huge for standard containers. In order to not have their houses carried away, locals make giant clay pots for it to inhabit instead.
cobblemon.species.pueblant.name: Pueblant
cobblemon.species.pueblant.desc: The sprawling colonies built by Pueblant have inspired human architects for millennia. These structures are harder than concrete, lasting for generations.
cobblemon.species.cahokisect.name: Cahokisect
cobblemon.species.cahokisect.desc: Cahokisect's bejeweled carapace made it a symbol of wealth in ancient times. As a result, it is commonly found in the tombs of nobility and royalty.
cobblemon.species.cobrasket.name: Cobrasket
cobblemon.species.cobrasket.desc: Its resting, coiled body resembles a basket. Many unsuspecting merchants have been startled when they reached for one, only to be met with loud hissing.
cobblemon.species.charmbra.name: Charmbra
cobblemon.species.charmbra.desc: Charmbra passes air through the holes on its body to create a melody that hypnotizes its prey. The dazed targets are unable to escape its toxic fangs.
cobblemon.species.cairup.name: Cairup
cobblemon.species.cairup.desc: When it thinks nobody is looking, Cairup has been known to have one-sided talks with its tail. The eye on its forehead stays closed until it's fully developed.
cobblemon.species.kairoglyph.name: Kairoglyph
cobblemon.species.kairoglyph.desc: Kairoglyph values secrets and riddles above all else. The eye on its tail can reveal the innermost secrets of both humans and Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.necronite.name: Necronite
cobblemon.species.necronite.desc: Necronite emits a strange frequency as it floats about the ancient ruins it inhabits. Making contact with this Pokémon can leave one lightheaded.
cobblemon.species.gravollum.name: Gravollum
cobblemon.species.gravollum.desc: Gravollum will sleep motionless for thousands of years, only to awaken and relocate. This has led to ancient monuments seemingly vanishing overnight.
cobblemon.species.diloweed.name: Diloweed
cobblemon.species.diloweed.desc: As food in the desert is scarce, the plates on Diloweed's back absorb solar energy. It curls itself up into a ball and lets the wind carry it if it is tired.
cobblemon.species.pangolash.name: Pangolash
cobblemon.species.pangolash.desc: The plates on Pangolash's back have not only hardened to be highly durable, but also developed sharp edges capable of shredding nearly anything to pieces.
cobblemon.species.ignishell.name: Ignishell
cobblemon.species.ignishell.desc: Ignishell is still young, so its shell has not completely formed. In battle it worriedly covers its soft underbelly, which is very susceptible to attacks.
cobblemon.species.shelosene.name: Shelosene
cobblemon.species.shelosene.desc: Shelosene proudly displays its carapace to show its endurance. The Shelosene with the least damaged shell is idolised by the nest.
cobblemon.species.flarrapin.name: Flarrapin
cobblemon.species.flarrapin.desc: Flarrapin exposes its shell to extreme heat to repair and strengthen it. It is said that the average Flarrapins shell has been completely reforged 5 times.
cobblemon.species.desoula.name: Desoula
cobblemon.species.desoula.desc: Desoula feeds on the souls of creatures who have become exhausted by the desert. This nimble Pokémon zips around the desert sands in search of food.
cobblemon.species.necrow.name: Necrow
cobblemon.species.necrow.desc: Necrow has been known to lure people into the desert in an attempt to make them get lost. It then quietly watches from afar, awaiting its prey's demise.
cobblemon.species.vultergyst.name: Vultergyst
cobblemon.species.vultergyst.desc: Vultergyst is considered a harbinger of death. It scours the desert skies in search of fading souls then puts them to rest in its cloak of black feathers.
cobblemon.species.dinkywink.name: Dinkywink
cobblemon.species.dinkywink.desc: While Dinkywink's mouth contains huge, razor sharp teeth, it has yet to develop the strength to utilize them. As such, it prefers to hunt by ramming into prey.
cobblemon.species.dunkywunkr.name: Dunkywunkr
cobblemon.species.dunkywunkr.desc: After its legs had fully developed, Dunkywunkr was able to become the apex predator not only in the seas from which it emerged, but also on dry land.
cobblemon.species.calphite.name: Calphite
cobblemon.species.calphite.desc: Calphite spent many of its early years with its mother. Despite its massive size, it scared easily and trampled much in its path when running in fear.
cobblemon.species.indrolith.name: Indrolith
cobblemon.species.indrolith.desc: Very few things can penetrate Indrolith's impervious hide. This earthen behemoth ferociously defends its own when under attack.
cobblemon.species.solacari.name: Solacari
cobblemon.species.solacari.desc: Ancient peoples venerated Solacari as the herald of the rising sun. Kings would keep many of them in hopes of a long reign.
cobblemon.species.nurshary.name: Nurshary
cobblemon.species.nurshary.desc: Nursharys maternal instinct extends beyond its own children. It will often adopt sick or injured Pokémon, caring for them until they return to health.
cobblemon.species.loneleaf.name: Loneleaf
cobblemon.species.loneleaf.desc: Loneleaf considers itself to be ugly and creepy. It carves a wooden mask with a large smile on it to make friends. Sadly, this only alienates it even further.
cobblemon.species.forthorn.name: Forthorn
cobblemon.species.forthorn.desc: Forthorn masquerades as a guardian of the forest, scaring off intruders to awe its fellow Pokémon. In reality, it is quite bashful and desires acceptance.
cobblemon.species.coltergeist.name: Coltergeist
cobblemon.species.coltergeist.desc: The icy blue gazes of Coltergeist herds can often be seen in thick fog patches. Their eerie cries not only cause chills, but also strange, indescribable dreams.
cobblemon.species.fantasmare.name: Fantasmare
cobblemon.species.fantasmare.desc: Fantasmare wanders in the mountains and hills where it stalks lone travellers. It is said to haunt the dreams of those who have seen it.
cobblemon.species.chihaha.name: Chihaha
cobblemon.species.chihaha.desc: Chihaha loves nothing more than to make people laugh. It may look silly and clumsy to some, but in reality, it takes fake pratfalls for the sake of humor.
cobblemon.species.howlequin.name: Howlequin
cobblemon.species.howlequin.desc: Despite lacking thumbs, its dexterity is superior to humans'. Wild Howlequin often taunt trainers by juggling the balls that were too weak to catch it.
cobblemon.species.chegrin.name: Chegrin
cobblemon.species.chegrin.desc: Chegrin takes delight in playing tricks on smaller Pokémon, scaring them with its flexible tail, but all too often, it ends up accidentally scaring itself.
cobblemon.species.cheshade.name: Cheshade
cobblemon.species.cheshade.desc: Cheshade's mane resembles a toothy smile. Hunting in the dark, it appears only as a sinister grin, striking prey with its shadowy claws as they are transfixed.
cobblemon.species.doppole.name: Doppole
cobblemon.species.doppole.desc: Doppole wears a half of a broken Poké Ball as a sturdy improvised helmet. Whilst it might act bold and spunky, in reality, it loves being coddled.
cobblemon.species.artifish.name: Artifish
cobblemon.species.artifish.desc: Despite its predator-like appearance, Artifish is very kind and laid back. It uses its Poké Ball bait to play with other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.thoraxe.name: Thoraxe
cobblemon.species.thoraxe.desc: It uses its axe-like claws to remove trees and other obstacles. When its abdomen is filled with water, Thoraxe puts out fires with pressurized streams.
cobblemon.species.pomparunt.name: Pomparunt
cobblemon.species.pomparunt.desc: Pomparunt is commonly found skulking around densely populated cities. It scavenges for food in small packs and often fights with others over scraps.
cobblemon.species.pompagoon.name: Pompagoon
cobblemon.species.pompagoon.desc: Being much stronger and bolder, gangs of Pompagoon will bully Pomparunt out of food. Oftentimes they will then fight among themselves for the stolen loot.
cobblemon.species.hyekuza.name: Hyekuza
cobblemon.species.hyekuza.desc: Fiercely proud and protective of its hairdo, the Hyekuza with the largest and most extravagant pompadour is considered the leader of the pack.
cobblemon.species.erycoon.name: Erycoon
cobblemon.species.erycoon.desc: Erycoon is constantly taking care of the forest it calls its home. It carries seeds and berries in its pouch-like tail to be planted or fed to weaker Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.leukoon.name: Leukoon
cobblemon.species.leukoon.desc: Scientists call Leukoon the immune system of nature. It is able to engulf any threat to its habitat using its massive, void-like maw.
cobblemon.species.toxito.name: Toxito
cobblemon.species.toxito.desc: The bane of swamps and other wet places, Toxito is dangerous in swarms. It is individually considered a pest, though, and is deterred with ease.
cobblemon.species.sanguito.name: Sanguito
cobblemon.species.sanguito.desc: Sanguito's antennae can sense warmth, helping it find prey in its dimly-lit swamp habitat. It emits a numbing toxin that keeps it undetected while it feeds.
cobblemon.species.orett.name: Orett
cobblemon.species.orett.desc: Born deep underground, Orett feeds on ore to keep its metallic shell strong. The composition of its body depends on what kind of ore it feeds on.
cobblemon.species.anvelid.name: Anvelid
cobblemon.species.anvelid.desc: Anvelid incubates inside mineral-rich cave walls in order to grow. However, it will ferociously attack any Pokémon or people who disturb its hibernation.
cobblemon.species.magroplex.name: Magroplex
cobblemon.species.magroplex.desc: Notoriously protective of its community, Magroplex will go so far as to collapse mines approaching its nests. Its durable body allows it to dig miles underground.
cobblemon.species.viipii.name: Viipii
cobblemon.species.viipii.desc: Although they are friendly to most Pokémon, in the wild, groups of Viipii are known to bicker and fight over nothing for days on end.
cobblemon.species.chilloth.name: Chilloth
cobblemon.species.chilloth.desc: Chilloth floats calmly in the water by connecting its arms to make an inner tube. It lets swimmers hold on when they need to catch their breath.
cobblemon.species.soakoth.name: Soakoth
cobblemon.species.soakoth.desc: Soakoth drifts nonchalantly along river rapids as if they were a gentle stream. Pokémon that can't swim sometimes climb on its belly to cross bodies of water.
cobblemon.species.chayan.name: Chayan
cobblemon.species.chayan.desc: Chayan is a born fighter, sparring with others mere hours after birth. It competes with others in challenges of skill and strength, striving to improve.
cobblemon.species.macuarrior.name: Macuarrior
cobblemon.species.macuarrior.desc: The edges of Macuarrior's blades are extremely sharp. Through constant honing, these blades can effortlessly cut through concrete.
cobblemon.species.ocerumi.name: Ocerumi
cobblemon.species.ocerumi.desc: Ocerumi encases its hands in special clay, baking them in harsh sun. When dried, these stone gauntlets can resist even Ocerumi's earth-shattering punch.
cobblemon.species.fortifry.name: Fortifry
cobblemon.species.fortifry.desc: Only Fortifry that learn to care for others will evolve. Though they are numerous and hardy, few Fortifry evolve due to their inherently selfish nature.
cobblemon.species.oarwish.name: Oarwish
cobblemon.species.oarwish.desc: Oarwish is known to emerge only to help people in need. This has gained it a reputation amongst sailors that it is a sign of luck and can grant wishes.
cobblemon.species.smashiary.name: Smashiary
cobblemon.species.smashiary.desc: Smashiary's reckless fighting style makes use of its long legs and aerial superiority to swoop onto enemies in a flurry of bone-shattering kicks.
cobblemon.species.slatic.name: Slatic
cobblemon.species.slatic.desc: Slatic has not yet mastered its powers of light distortion. As a result, its body parts will suddenly appear out of nowhere as its camouflage falters.
cobblemon.species.telsion.name: Telsion
cobblemon.species.telsion.desc: Telsion's lightning fast tongue carries an impressive electric current that cooks small bugs alive and can stun even the heftiest of opponents.
cobblemon.species.chameleohm.name: Chameleohm
cobblemon.species.chameleohm.desc: By using its ability to manipulate electromagnetic waves, Chameleohm can disrupt the light around it and render itself invisible to the naked eye.
cobblemon.species.glauqua.name: Glauqua
cobblemon.species.glauqua.desc: Even though Glauqua is highly venomous, it is known to be playful and enjoy making new friends. Still, one should try to stay away from its poisonous horns.
cobblemon.species.hydranticus.name: Hydranticus
cobblemon.species.hydranticus.desc: Hydranticus is a curious Pokémon that loves soaring behind ships for weeks on end, happily absorbing the toxic runoff left in their wakes.
cobblemon.species.lintle.name: Lintle
cobblemon.species.lintle.desc: The luster of Lintle's mane is indicative of its health. From birth, it always travels as part of a pair, and remain with its partner its whole life.
cobblemon.species.silkinder.name: Silkinder
cobblemon.species.silkinder.desc: The ribbons on Silkinder's neck are very sensitive, and shine in the moonlight. Silkinder often entwine ribbons as an affectionate gesture.
cobblemon.species.paramoth.name: Paramoth
cobblemon.species.paramoth.desc: On rare occasions, Paramoth will cloud together and perform a complicated, colorful dance. Some say this is related to the movements of the moon.
cobblemon.species.parapy.name: Parapy
cobblemon.species.parapy.desc: Parapy grows inside the mouth of a fish and replaces the tongue of its host. It uses its host's body as a trojan horse, attacking unwitting prey as it swims by.
cobblemon.species.mawasite.name: Mawasite
cobblemon.species.mawasite.desc: Mawasite has now fully overtaken its host's mind and body. By seizing complete control, the bodies have become inseparable.
cobblemon.species.chimpoca.name: Chimpoca
cobblemon.species.chimpoca.desc: Chimpoca, though typically naïve and clumsy, all aspire to become the leaders of their troops. Their brazen actions often lead them into trouble.
cobblemon.species.simayan.name: Simayan
cobblemon.species.simayan.desc: Simayan spend all their time sparring with each other. Their aim is to show that they are the strongest in the group, and thus become the next leader.
cobblemon.species.monkezuma.name: Monkezuma
cobblemon.species.monkezuma.desc: There can be only one Monkezuma per troop, who leads the rest with an iron fist. If another Simayan evolves, the two battle, and the loser is exiled.
cobblemon.species.enigmite.name: Enigmite
cobblemon.species.enigmite.desc: Enigmite selects a round stone and rolls it around tirelessly. When the stone becomes perfectly smooth, Enigmite gains psychic powers.
cobblemon.species.enigmantis.name: Enigmantis
cobblemon.species.enigmantis.desc: Enigmantis uses its perfectly rounded gem to focus its psychic powers. Robbing it of its stone leaves it sluggish and listless.
cobblemon.species.arjibi.name: Arjibi
cobblemon.species.arjibi.desc: Arjibi absorbs light with its colored fins to produce energy. In bright light, it flits about energetically, so fast that film barely registers it as a blur.
cobblemon.species.royjibiv.name: Royjibiv
cobblemon.species.royjibiv.desc: Royjibiv's iridescent scales reflect and amplify sunlight. When flying overhead, this causes it to bathe the ground below it in every color imaginable.
cobblemon.species.barracute.name: Barracute
cobblemon.species.barracute.desc: Barracute hides in the narrow openings between rocks to protect its soft body. It will stick its head out and bite anything unlucky enough to get near it.
cobblemon.species.jawgodon.name: Jawgodon
cobblemon.species.jawgodon.desc: Despite being a fast swimmer, Jawgodon prefers stealing others' prey and eating carrion rather than hunting. It will search on land if food is scarce.
cobblemon.species.drosire.name: Drosire
cobblemon.species.drosire.desc: Drosire cannot draw nutrients from the soil, so it uses its vines to hang from trees and catch bugs. Unaware humans may accidentally walk into it face first.
cobblemon.species.sunduke.name: Sunduke
cobblemon.species.sunduke.desc: Sunduke lead groups of Drosire in return for reverence. As such, they have long been a symbol of royalty, and ancient Urobians fashioned their regalia on them.
cobblemon.species.wispern.name: Wispern
cobblemon.species.wispern.desc: It is common to find a procession of Wispern at a funeral. It is believed that they are there to safely guide the deceased to the afterlife.
cobblemon.species.phantern.name: Phantern
cobblemon.species.phantern.desc: Phantern congregate in large groups at times of celebration. Oddly, its ghostly lights are known to appear at both festivals and funerals.
cobblemon.species.glocto.name: Glocto
cobblemon.species.glocto.desc: Gloctos molten innards form constantly shifting bubbles of glowing lava. This strange, yet beautiful phenomenon is visible from above the oceans surface.
cobblemon.species.lavoon.name: Lavoon
cobblemon.species.lavoon.desc: Lavoon releases molten secretions from its blowhole, which gradually rise to the surface and cool. People collect them to use as alternative fuel.
cobblemon.species.gilla.name: Gilla
cobblemon.species.gilla.desc: From the moment it hatches, Gilla must fend for itself. It hunts on its own, even in its infancy, using poison glands filled with toxic venom.
cobblemon.species.hornizard.name: Hornizard
cobblemon.species.hornizard.desc: Hornizards spines contain a potent venom, while its skin secretes an acidic compound. Due to these defenses, it has almost no natural predators.
cobblemon.species.ankillosore.name: Ankillosore
cobblemon.species.ankillosore.desc: Ankillosore will let attackers strike its thick hide so it can line up a blow with its tail. If the impact doesn't fell the foe, the venom surely will.
cobblemon.species.bazilisk.name: Bazilisk
cobblemon.species.bazilisk.desc: While sunbathing, Bazilisk lays in tall grass so that only its dorsal leaf is visible. When prey passes by, however, it jumps up and snaps at it quickly.
cobblemon.species.ornitherb.name: Ornitherb
cobblemon.species.ornitherb.desc: Ornitherb work together to steal eggs from other Pokémon's nests. A few will distract the parents while others make off with their target.
cobblemon.species.dilophlora.name: Dilophlora
cobblemon.species.dilophlora.desc: Dilophlora will commit every rock and plant in its jungle to memory. That way it can swiftly avoid any obstacle while chasing down its prey at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.baboom.name: Baboom
cobblemon.species.baboom.desc: Baboom is vicious towards any outsiders. It can build up an electric charge by rapidly slapping its own rear, which causes thunderous blasts of lightning.
cobblemon.species.icetope.name: Icetope
cobblemon.species.icetope.desc: Icetope's innards are in the constant danger of overheating and melting down. To counteract this, it maintains an extremely low body temperature.
cobblemon.species.chillnobyl.name: Chillnobyl
cobblemon.species.chillnobyl.desc: Chillnobyl appears near radioactive sites and absorbs the radiation there. It is often used to clean up nuclear waste and seek out leaks in nuclear reactors.
cobblemon.species.wendingo.name: Wendingo
cobblemon.species.wendingo.desc: Wendingo lives in a tight-knit pack. It uses its coloration to blend in with its snowy habitat, then cooperates with the pack to take down larger prey.
cobblemon.species.carnibal.name: Carnibal
cobblemon.species.carnibal.desc: Carnibal's ravaging hunger is never satisfied. It can't stand the thought of sharing food with others, so it leaves the pack to hunt on its own.
cobblemon.species.luchito.name: Luchito
cobblemon.species.luchito.desc: Luchito practice grabs and throws on rocks to develop their own signature move. Despite their size, their tail stores a powerful electric charge.
cobblemon.species.eluchadon.name: Eluchadon
cobblemon.species.eluchadon.desc: When Eluchadon is challenged, it holds nothing back against its foe. It builds up static energy in its mane to unleash in an electrifying finishing move.
cobblemon.species.grolem.name: Grolem
cobblemon.species.grolem.desc: Acting as a sentry for temples, Grolem forms a symbiosis with the moss and foliage it wears. Roots run through it like circuitry to deliver solar energy.
cobblemon.species.comossus.name: Comossus
cobblemon.species.comossus.desc: Comossus is theorized to have served as a sentinel for bygone civilizations. It is able to focus natural energies into powerful destructive beams.
cobblemon.species.larvyn.name: Larvyn
cobblemon.species.larvyn.desc: Larvyn's appetite is ravenous. It will eat almost anything, be it wood, rocks or even metal. It uses the nutrients to slowly develop a sturdy shell.
cobblemon.species.dracoon.name: Dracoon
cobblemon.species.dracoon.desc: Having encased itself in a rigid shell, Dracoon begins its transformation. It hardly moves at all, instead directing its entire attention to its growth.
cobblemon.species.basilect.name: Basilect
cobblemon.species.basilect.desc: Basilect uses its powerful pincers to shear and jab at foes. Opposing Basilect will grapple with their pincers and try to hurl the other as far as they can.
cobblemon.species.carbite.name: Carbite
cobblemon.species.carbite.desc: Carbite consumes minerals in excess to toughen its rocky hide. It prefers carbon, so it will occasionally go after live prey.
cobblemon.species.pressaur.name: Pressaur
cobblemon.species.pressaur.desc: Pressaur compresses the minerals it consumes, producing so much energy that it must expel heat through the vents that run along its rugged body.
cobblemon.species.diamat.name: Diamat
cobblemon.species.diamat.desc: In battle, Diamat refracts light through its glittering body to blind foes, then finishes them off with its powerful, unbreakable claws.
cobblemon.species.quecko.name: Quecko
cobblemon.species.quecko.desc: Quecko is hard to find and catch; this makes it very sought after not only by trainers, but also by healers who use its leaves to make medicine.
cobblemon.species.tozecko.name: Tozecko
cobblemon.species.tozecko.desc: Tozecko was worshipped as a god of wind and harvest in ancient times. When offered tribute, it would ensure clear skies and bountiful crops.
cobblemon.species.crakling.name: Crakling
cobblemon.species.crakling.desc: If one hears sharp explosions with no one around, it might be a Crakling, blowing up pebbles for fun. Its tail constantly shoots bright sparks.
cobblemon.species.fuelong.name: Fuelong
cobblemon.species.fuelong.desc: Fuelong idly rests in the clouds at day, but at night it awakes and breathes its colorful fire. From below, it looks like a display of brilliant fireworks.
cobblemon.species.draggar.name: Draggar
cobblemon.species.draggar.desc: Draggar looks fierce from afar, but it is in fact very jovial. It enjoys swimming through even the roughest seas, unafraid of storms or large waves.
cobblemon.species.ragnarow.name: Ragnarow
cobblemon.species.ragnarow.desc: On foggy nights, Ragnarow is often mistaken for an abandoned vessel. Sailors tell stories of the terrible shipwrecks that occur if Ragnarow is approached.
cobblemon.species.eronze.name: Eronze
cobblemon.species.eronze.desc: Eronze's body is made from an ancient metal alloy lost to modern science. It can withstand intense heat and force without the slightest bit of damage.
cobblemon.species.erion.name: Erion
cobblemon.species.erion.desc: Erion is an industrial titan, ravenously consuming fuel and spewing it out as toxic smog. Plants and Pokémon in its wake wither and gasp for air.
cobblemon.species.erace.name: Erace
cobblemon.species.erace.desc: Thought to be damaged beyond repair, Erace was retrofitted with state-of-the-art technology. Its new, advanced body can even withstand atmospheric re-entry.
cobblemon.species.patama.name: Patama
cobblemon.species.patama.desc: Patama presides over land and forests, caring for the plants and Pokémon. It perpetuates the life cycle, making sure death always brings forth new life.
cobblemon.species.machima.name: Machima
cobblemon.species.machima.desc: Machima is said to wander the badlands, shrouded in a perpetual sandstorm. In legend, it whisks intruders away from the desert on a cushion of wind.
cobblemon.species.yacuma.name: Yacuma
cobblemon.species.yacuma.desc: Seeing Yacuma's lights floating in the deep is a bad omen for sailors. Ships that pollute the sea are unlikely to escape its wrath and return to shore.
cobblemon.species.quetzar.name: Quetzar
cobblemon.species.quetzar.desc: Quetzar's wings inspired the ancient Urobians to name the constellations. Legends warn that if it leaves, the night sky will turn pitch black.
cobblemon.species.quetzarspace.name: Quetzar
cobblemon.species.quetzarspace.desc: Quetzar's wings inspired the ancient Urobians to name the constellations. Legends warn that if it leaves, the night sky will turn pitch black.
cobblemon.species.xochi.name: Xochi
cobblemon.species.xotec.name: Xotec
cobblemon.species.meadew.name: Meadew
cobblemon.species.ninfae.name: Ninfae
cobblemon.species.faeuna.name: Faeuna
cobblemon.species.mousic.name: Mousic
cobblemon.species.rabatuta.name: Rabatuta
cobblemon.species.flamelin.name: Flamelin
cobblemon.species.gulliby.name: Gulliby
cobblemon.species.saigull.name: Saigull
cobblemon.species.seaghoul.name: Seaghoul
cobblemon.species.lukpup.name: Lukpup
cobblemon.species.lukpup.desc: A shy Pokémon that only appears in perfect weather conditions. It's seen so rarely that some people aren't convinced that they're real.
cobblemon.species.lukagon.name: Lukagon
cobblemon.species.lukagon.desc: To see a Lukagon in the wild requires incredible luck. It is said that if a Lukagon rubs up against you that you will be cured of any disease you may have.
cobblemon.species.kokiseed.name: Kokiseed
cobblemon.species.kokiseed.desc: A small seed-like Pokémon that enjoys dancing at festivals. It scatters its leaves around for pizaz. It will sometimes try to imitate stronger Pokémon fighting.
cobblemon.species.kokipound.name: Kokipound
cobblemon.species.kokipound.desc: Their passion for dance transitions to martial arts. Can be found sparring on beaches. It hits palm tree trunks with its bare fists.
cobblemon.species.kokismash.name: Kokismash
cobblemon.species.kokismash.desc: These Pokémon are gentle in nature, despite their intimidating demeanor. They enjoy dancing, sparring, and lifting heavy things. They like to protect smaller friends.
cobblemon.species.chargo.name: Chargo
cobblemon.species.chargo.desc: A mountain Pokémon that is kept around villages to keep people warm. They are ditzy and must be watched around flammable things.
cobblemon.species.burnaram.name: Burnaram
cobblemon.species.burnaram.desc: The Pokémon puts on some bulk after evolving as it learns better to control its body. They can stand still for hours, meditating.
cobblemon.species.psysteed.name: Psysteed
cobblemon.species.psysteed.desc: This Pokémon helps nomadic tribes haul building material using its telekenetic powers. Humans also dye the fur with archaic symbols.
cobblemon.species.darpole.name: Darpole
cobblemon.species.darpole.desc: This Pokémon likes to play pranks on trainers who get too close to the edge of a pond, and then dive down into the water where it can't be reached.
cobblemon.species.brutoad.name: Brutoad
cobblemon.species.brutoad.desc: Brutoad are known to be aggressive and territorial, following orders from a stronger lead Pokémon. Their fins are sharp on the edges.
cobblemon.species.godfrogger.name: Godfrogger
cobblemon.species.godfrogger.desc: A lethargic Pokémon that prefers to give orders to its underlings instead of doing things itself. It tries to control wild areas, usually humid and swampy locations.
cobblemon.species.gorochu.name: Gorochu
cobblemon.species.gorochu.desc: Gorochu are competitive by nature. They use their large tails, charged with electricity, to slash at their foes. They inhabit generally hot areas.
cobblemon.species.nidorook.name: Nidorook
cobblemon.species.nidorook.desc: When a Nidorino or Nidorina evolve into Nidorook, they maintain their quadruped form. This evolutionary branch has an emphasis on speed.
cobblemon.species.quezsparce.name: Quezsparce
cobblemon.species.quezsparce.desc: It uses its jaded chin as a plow to move dirt while tunneling. The growth in its wings allows it to be a faster, and more dangerous opponent above ground.
cobblemon.species.faeralynx.name: Faeralynx
cobblemon.species.faeralynx.desc: The fur of a Faeralynx is highly sought after by the wealthy elite. They tend to spend at least 6 hours a day grooming themselves.
cobblemon.species.skulkraken.name: Skulkraken
cobblemon.species.skulkraken.desc: A metal shell encasing a vicious sea creature. Its claws can rip through the steel hull of a ship. Legend has it that a giant Skulkraken exists in the vast oceans.
cobblemon.species.oozma.name: Oozma
cobblemon.species.oozma.desc: When Muk become too hot, their bodies transition into molten lava. Oozma feed off pools of lava to continue to maintain their high body temperature.
cobblemon.species.omeon.name: Omeon
cobblemon.species.omeon.desc: Omeon have a natural connection with the spirits. The flame on the end of its tail will flicker and blow in the direction of any unseen presence.
cobblemon.species.champeon.name: Champeon
cobblemon.species.champeon.desc: Champeon are naturally competitive and will seek out bigger opponents. Can often be found in alley ways, scrapping with the fiercest scavengers.
cobblemon.species.lepideon.name: Lepideon
cobblemon.species.lepideon.desc: Lepideon are natural pollen magnets. If a loved one of Lepideon has allergies to pollen, Lepideon will collect all the pollen in the area to help relieve the irritation.
cobblemon.species.guardeon.name: Guardeon
cobblemon.species.guardeon.desc: If Eevees in a pack evolve, the combination of Guardeon and Champeon can be volatile. Guardeon have an eternal rivalry with any Champeon they meet, even if related.
cobblemon.species.obsideon.name: Obsideon
cobblemon.species.obsideon.desc: Among mountainous Pokémon, it is relatively faster. It rams its obsidian covered spine against Graveler and Onix as a way of playing around to get them to chase it.
cobblemon.species.scorpeon.name: Scorpeon
cobblemon.species.scorpeon.desc: It has been said that Scorpeon's tail has a mind of its own. Scorpeon will get its prey to focus on its face while it steadily aims its stinger for the next strike.
cobblemon.species.sphynxeon.name: Sphynxeon
cobblemon.species.sphynxeon.desc: In ancient times, Sphynxeon were treated as a divine beings sent from the heavens. Many of the designs from the royal wardrobes were inspired by Sphynxeon.
cobblemon.species.nimbeon.name: Nimbeon
cobblemon.species.nimbeon.desc: Nimbeon floats through the air, barely grazing the surface as it's used as a pushing-off point. If winds get too strong, it can blow Nimbeon away.
cobblemon.species.draconeon.name: Draconeon
cobblemon.species.draconeon.desc: Draconeon are considered exotic and are rarely seen outside of Blackthorn City in Johto. Though smaller than most dragons, Draconeon are fierce and passionate.
cobblemon.species.eeveeon.name: Eeveeon
cobblemon.species.eeveeon.desc: Eeveeon is the result of an Eevee with stable DNA. When exposed to the pure energy of an Astral Stone, Eevee is able to maintain its Normal typing during evolution.
cobblemon.species.vareon.name: Vareon
cobblemon.species.vareon.desc: Vareon is the result of an Eevee trying to adapt to overly mutated DNA. This Pokémon seems to be able to change its typing fluidly throughout battle.
cobblemon.species.terathwack.name: Terathwack
cobblemon.species.terathwack.desc: A rarely seen evolution to Marowak. The skull once worn as a Cubone has now become a natural part of the Pokémon. Can often be seen protecting wild Kangaskhan.
cobblemon.species.grimfowl.name: Grimfowl
cobblemon.species.grimfowl.desc: In ancient times, people believed Grimfowl to be the harbinger of death, sent from the underworld. Nowadays its feathers are used as funeral décor.
cobblemon.species.sunflorid.name: Sunflorid
cobblemon.species.sunflorid.desc: Sunflorid converts solar energy into nutrition and stores the excess for future use in battle. It has a tendency to singe its own hands while using Fire based attacks.
cobblemon.species.sorcerice.name: Sorcerice
cobblemon.species.sorcerice.desc: This Pokémon's elemental abilities are so powerful that it must live in isolation while maintaining constant focus to prevent itself from freezing everything around it.
cobblemon.species.kecleodon.name: Kecleodon
cobblemon.species.kecleodon.desc: Kecleodon are so good at blending in with their environments, that it was only just discovered recently that Kecleon could even evolve at all.
cobblemon.species.wereyena.name: Wereyena
cobblemon.species.wereyena.desc: In rare occasion, when Mightyena are exposed to pure moonlight, they will evolve into Wereyena. Legends said that these Pokémon were just transformed humans.
cobblemon.species.reaptide.name: Reaptide
cobblemon.species.reaptide.desc: Reaptide lurks in murky waters, searching for prey. It drags its victims deep into the water where they succumb to the high pressure, or suffocate.
cobblemon.species.kidfoot.name: Kidfoot
cobblemon.species.kidfoot.desc: Most people consider Kidfoot to be a myth, being rarely seen by the average person. Because they are so elusive, little research has been done on them.
cobblemon.species.snosquatch.name: Snosquatch
cobblemon.species.snosquatch.desc: Snosquatch can be highly aggressive and prone to fits of rage, which can become so intense that they cause avalanches. It will claim mountain tops as its territory.
cobblemon.species.grasquatch.name: Grasquatch
cobblemon.species.grasquatch.desc: Grasquatch's existence was a subject of debate for many years due to its rarity. It is seen as a peaceful guardian of any forest that it inhabits.
cobblemon.species.arctusk.name: Arctusk
cobblemon.species.arctusk.desc: It is believed that Arctusk may share a common ancestor with Phanpy, due to their similar biology. Arctusk roamed frigid environments hundreds of years ago.
cobblemon.species.gigantusk.name: Gigantusk
cobblemon.species.gigantusk.desc: This Pokémon was revived from a specimen found frozen in an ancient glacier. It was hunted by ancient humans for its extremely durable armor.
cobblemon.species.iceros.name: Iceros
cobblemon.species.iceros.desc: At birth, Iceros lacks the strength to lift its horn off the ground. It relies on the care of its herd to survive until it becomes strong enough to move on its own.
cobblemon.species.glacieros.name: Glacieros
cobblemon.species.glacieros.desc: Glacieros shares a common ancestor with the Rhyhorn family. The horn is encased in ice, which makes up about half of the total body weight of these Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.mockroach.name: Mockroach
cobblemon.species.mockroach.desc: Mockroach can detach its head and use it as a projectile. Luckily it can survive for up to three months without its head attached, because it tends to lose it.
cobblemon.species.jollibird.name: Jollibird
cobblemon.species.jollibird.desc: Jollibird will only be in the presence of people who have been nice all year round. Given the nature of human beings, very few people have seen a Jollibird.
cobblemon.species.kablowfish.name: Kablowfish
cobblemon.species.kablowfish.desc: The inside of Kablowfish's body is so highly pressurized that just touching it can cause it to burst, releasing a large cloud of poisonous gas.
cobblemon.species.scalarva.name: Scalarva
cobblemon.species.scalarva.desc: Despite its appearance, Scalarva is actually rather docile. It relies on its sharp spikes and scales for protection, only using violence as a last resort.
cobblemon.species.dragalis.name: Dragalis
cobblemon.species.dragalis.desc: Dragalis's body is composed of solid scales over a dense layer of silk. Its true power slumbers within the innermost layer, waiting to be unleashed.
cobblemon.species.ceregal.name: Ceregal
cobblemon.species.ceregal.desc: In the distant past, it was believed that anyone capable of taming Ceregal was destined to rule. The pattern on its wings take on the face of a frightening dragon.
cobblemon.species.gargon.name: Gargon
cobblemon.species.gargon.desc: Gargon is one of the earliest discovered Dragon Pokémon, and was a symbol of the Dragon Tamer Clan in Johto. Statues of this Pokémon are scattered around the world.
cobblemon.species.wardern.name: Wardern
cobblemon.species.wardern.desc: In ancient times, there was much debate over whether Wardern's ferocity came from its desire to fight evil or it being a vessel for evil itself.
cobblemon.species.dragoyle.name: Dragoyle
cobblemon.species.dragoyle.desc: Hundreds of years ago, this Pokémon would be perched atop cathedrals and large stone architecture. It seemed to want to protect the inhabitants below.
cobblemon.species.porygonx.name: PorygonX
cobblemon.species.porygonx.desc: Porygon-X is an upgrade to Porygon, programmed by Professor Thorn. It is designed to translate quantum data between infinite realities.
cobblemon.species.viledoom.name: Viledoom
cobblemon.species.viledoom.desc: Its rotten pollen have turned into deadly spores. Viledoom live dissacoiated from any other living beings due their spores being too dangerous for any ecosystem.
cobblemon.species.mortossum.name: Mortossum
cobblemon.species.mortossum.desc: Mortossum managed to rid its body from the poisonous spores. Despite Mortossums destructive past, its will to focus and act towards the greater good has remained.
cobblemon.species.mushling.name: Mushling
cobblemon.species.mushling.desc: Consuming the spores from this Pokémon has been known to cause psychic hallucinations. It can also lead to nausea and migraines, it is not advised.
cobblemon.species.psycholyte.name: Psycholyte
cobblemon.species.psycholyte.desc: Upon evolution, this Pokémon goes hunting for a suitable stick. They form a strong bond with the chosen stick and use it to channel its psychic powers.
cobblemon.species.shroomage.name: Shroomage
cobblemon.species.shroomage.desc: The spores that Shroomage give off have been found to be dangerous. Hallucinations and other symptoms can sometimes last days. Some people believe the spores grant the consumer special powers.
cobblemon.species.calfpint.name: Calfpint
cobblemon.species.calfpint.desc: They are usually found around their mothers, who are typically raised on farms. It is uncommon to see them by themselves in the wild. When startled, they charge.
cobblemon.species.arbird.name: Arbird
cobblemon.species.arbird.desc: Arbird are sent off on their own mere hours after hatching, left to fend for themselves. Their dense armor keeps them safe from potential predators.
cobblemon.species.girafaraf.name: Girafaraf
cobblemon.species.girafaraf.desc: Exposure to the energy of a Dawn Stone has allowed for the front brain to gain full control of itself. The rear brain withers and becomes just a standard tail.
cobblemon.species.giragira.name: Giragira
cobblemon.species.giragira.desc: Exposure to the energy of a Dusk Stone has strengthened the rear brain of Girafarig. In the process of evolution, the rear brain has convinced the front brain to surrender its power, giving control to the darker half.
cobblemon.species.whave.name: Whave
cobblemon.species.whave.desc: An outgoing whale Pokémon that generally dwells in the deep seas. It is playful with other Pokémon as long as it's not battling.
cobblemon.species.orcabyss.name: Orcabyss
cobblemon.species.orcabyss.desc: A ferocious creature that will impale anything that moves too quickly in an aggressive manner. Its horn is strong enough to burrow through glaciers.
cobblemon.species.zapalope.name: Zapalope
cobblemon.species.zapalope.desc: A Pokémon that zips through dense forests with ease. Its electrical energy allows it to move at high speeds. You can tell a Zapalope trail by the singed edges of the plants around it.
cobblemon.species.joltalope.name: Joltalope
cobblemon.species.joltalope.desc: A Pokémon that expends high amounts of energy during its active hours. During its resting hours, it sleeps for long periods of time in overgrown forest nests. The foliage starts to take root in Joltalopes fur.
cobblemon.species.mewthree.name: Mewthree
cobblemon.species.mewthree.desc: Thorn created this creature, via genetic manipulation, using DNA from Mewtwo and Deoxys. It was meant to be a counter to Arkhaos, but has never been put to the test.
cobblemon.species.oculeus.name: Oculeus
cobblemon.species.oculeus.desc: Oculeus exists as an omniscient, universal force. It uses Unown to observe life all over the universe. Once the Unown is done observing, it is absorbed into Oculeus.
cobblemon.species.arkhaos.name: Arkhaos
cobblemon.species.arkhaos.desc: Arkhaos exists in the void between dimensions, where it lays eggs that spawn Arceus with a new universe. Its rotating ring is used to create rifts in reality.
cobblemon.species.beagasso.name: Beagasso
cobblemon.species.panditsy.name: Panditsy
cobblemon.species.panditsy.desc: Panditsy's unsteady movements are so mesmerizing that just a few moments of observation cause trainers and Pokemon to move in the same fashion. The hypnotic swirl on their head can be dangerous if one is not careful.
cobblemon.species.zangarsh.name: Zangarsh
cobblemon.species.snampery.name: Snampery
cobblemon.species.descargot.name: Descargot
cobblemon.species.gastesla.name: Gastesla
cobblemon.species.flasinge.name: Flasinge
cobblemon.species.shaboon.name: Shaboon
cobblemon.species.lunaye.name: Lunaye
cobblemon.species.swolphin.name: Swolphin
cobblemon.species.norspear.name: Norspear
cobblemon.species.narvalor.name: Narvalor
cobblemon.species.cefireon.name: Cefireon
cobblemon.species.cefireon.desc: Draconeon are considered exotic and are rarely seen outside of Blackthorn City in Johto. Though smaller than most dragons, Draconeon are fierce and passionate.
cobblemon.species.polekin.name: Polekin
cobblemon.species.fungorse.name: Fungorse
cobblemon.species.cervantrier.name: Cervantrier
cobblemon.species.lugnis.name: Lugnis
cobblemon.species.luravit.name: Luravit
cobblemon.species.luxpiravit.name: Luxpiravit
cobblemon.species.quisquite.name: Quisquite
cobblemon.species.gambarrel.name: Gambarrel
cobblemon.species.bogaleon.name: Bogaleon
cobblemon.species.astrem.name: Astrem
cobblemon.species.unktena.name: Unktena
cobblemon.species.crabble.name: Crabble
cobblemon.species.crabble.desc: It uses its large claw to knock fruit down from trees. Although its soft outer layer makes it resemble a tasty fruit, its bright coloration is actually to warn predators that it tastes foul.
cobblemon.species.carapoma.name: Carapoma
cobblemon.species.carapoma.desc: The arm bearing the larger claw can extend to several times its resting length to clobber opponents. Conversely, the other claw is shrunken to near-uselessness.
cobblemon.species.crustorchard.name: Crustorchard
cobblemon.species.crustorchard.desc: Its shell is as rugged as stone, so all this Pokemon needs to avoid predators is to bunker down and pretend to be a particularly large and hard-to-chew fruit until they lose interest.
cobblemon.species.burrliz.name: Burrliz
cobblemon.species.burrliz.desc: When faced with danger, it prefers to stand its ground and fight no matter the odds, its spiny body making it hard for predators to safely attack.
cobblemon.species.reptack.name: Reptack
cobblemon.species.reptack.desc: Its tear ducts emit fire, and it can torch things with pinpoint accuracy as if shooting a ray of heat from its eyes, but it just as easily relies on its sharp claws to fight instead.
cobblemon.species.calientrop.name: Calientrop
cobblemon.species.calientrop.desc: By day, it buries itself to soak up heat from the sun and sand, with its spines jutting outward as a warning to stay away. Its spines routinely break off and regrow daily.
cobblemon.species.sharby.name: Sharby
cobblemon.species.sharby.desc: It's always on the move, so it rarely gets a chance to sleep. On the rare occasion it gets to take a nap, a strange aura emanates from it that pacifies everything around it too.
cobblemon.species.lamnaw.name: Lamnaw
cobblemon.species.lamnaw.desc: Every day, it dives to great depths that no human could explore without a submarine. Hunting in total darkness, it navigates using electrical pulses from its snout.
cobblemon.species.squalucid.name: Squalucid
cobblemon.species.squalucid.desc: Its own toxic blood enhances its psychic abilities by keeping it in a subconscious state. Though it is blind, it does not need eyesight in its deep sea habitat, and therefore its other senses are greatly heightened.
cobblemon.species.hoppoint.name: Hoppoint
cobblemon.species.hoppoint.desc: A plant-eating Pokémon that uses its horned head to poke through tree bark and eat the fresh wood within. Farmers despise Hoppoint as they like to devour their precious berry crops.
cobblemon.species.helmhide.name: Helmhide
cobblemon.species.helmhide.desc: Between evolutions, it simply ducks into its armored shell to protect its developing body. The horn gradually lengthens an inch every day.
cobblemon.species.durabarge.name: Durabarge
cobblemon.species.durabarge.desc: The horn on its armored head looks different between regions. Some are so extravagantly shaped that their exact purpose is currently unknown to science.
cobblemon.species.imbirbe.name: Imbirbe
cobblemon.species.imbirbe.desc: It daintily sips nectar from flowers with its long beak. In turn, it helps the plants grow extra healthy because of the natural fertilizer in its saliva.
cobblemon.species.kolalibri.name: Kolalibri
cobblemon.species.kolalibri.desc: Because of its extreme resistance to toxins, it favors bitter plants. Its beak is very flexible, twisting and bending to reach deep within flowers and guzzle up every last drop of nectar within.
cobblemon.species.blastun.name: Blastun
cobblemon.species.blastun.desc: By igniting the gases in its body, it can jet through the air like a missile. A hard headbutt from this Pokémon can easily dent steel.
cobblemon.species.bugbardier.name: Bugbardier
cobblemon.species.bugbardier.desc: When approached, it shows the bright colors on its shell as a warning to stay away. If provoked, it flips over and shoots a burst of fire from the nozzle on its back.
cobblemon.species.ensprout.name: Ensprout
cobblemon.species.ensprout.desc: Farmers carefully tend to this Pokémon to ensure it grows healthily before evolving. Its leaves look different depending on the type of soil it grows in.
cobblemon.species.treenanza.name: Treenanza
cobblemon.species.treenanza.desc: An assortment of different fruits grows from its body, so it is economically important. When stripped bare of its fruits, it goes dormant until they regrow.
cobblemon.species.cykit.name: Cykit
cobblemon.species.cykit.desc: People who look into its eye find themselves unable to resist doting on it. Some say it's really just because of its infectiously affectionate nature, however.
cobblemon.species.feleye.name: Feleye
cobblemon.species.feleye.desc: Its gaze pacifies foes, making them bend to the whims of this rather aloof Pokémon. It sits as still as a statue unless in the presence of a trusted companion.
cobblemon.species.scribish.name: Scribish
cobblemon.species.scribish.desc: The ink-like black markings on its back are unique to each individual. It eats lots of wood and paper to strengthen its thin exoskeleton.
cobblemon.species.papyrush.name: Papyrush
cobblemon.species.papyrush.desc: It has a keen understanding of written language, so it knows which books are the tastiest. This makes them a nuisance to libraries and other places where books are kept.
cobblemon.species.dirtusk.name: Dirtusk
cobblemon.species.dirtusk.desc: By bathing in mud, this Pokémon can keep cool even during the hot summer months. Due to this coating of mud, plants are sometimes seen sprouting from its head.
cobblemon.species.stalagrus.name: Stalagrus
cobblemon.species.stalagrus.desc: It's able to crush rocks with its heavy body alone. This Pokémon is extremely patient and can wait weeks for food to come by, often becoming cloaked in sand and harder for its prey to spot.
cobblemon.species.buroot.name: Buroot
cobblemon.species.buroot.desc: A plant-like Pokemon that lives underground. Since it can't get energy from the sun, it absorbs nutrients from the roots of desert plants.
cobblemon.species.stinginger.name: Stinginger
cobblemon.species.stinginger.desc: When not on the move, it pokes its tail out of the soil in search of prey. What looks like a fruit is actually a stinger that it uses to drain the life force from anything that comes near.
cobblemon.species.cuptus.name: Cuptus
cobblemon.species.cuptus.desc: Cuptus are born from the sand itself when lightning strikes in the desert. There, they will grow and become a hazard to people traveling across the desert.
cobblemon.species.cactank.name: Cactank
cobblemon.species.cactank.desc: It stores cool, fresh water in its body to withstand the intense heat of the desert. Finding a Cactank often means life or death for weary travelers.
cobblemon.species.colsector.name: Colsector
cobblemon.species.colsector.desc: It wears the cast-off shell of a Bug Pokemon as armor. It hunts the largest Bug-types to carve off parts of their exoskeleton to strengthen its armor.
cobblemon.species.shardodon.name: Shardodon
cobblemon.species.shardodon.desc: As the crystal on its back grows taller, shards of it break off and are left behind. These pieces are often collected and sold as souvenirs, but they are razor-sharp.
cobblemon.species.solardon.name: Solardon
cobblemon.species.solardon.desc: Heat concentrates in its crystal sail while it sunbathes, making it burn to the touch. If it overheats, it can release all of its stored heat energy at once in a scorching wave.
cobblemon.species.buzzoo.name: Buzzoo
cobblemon.species.buzzoo.desc: It's already self-sufficient right after hatching, but it will usually trek in packs of three. Using its keen sense of smell, it can sniff out food from miles awayany scraps will satisfy it.
cobblemon.species.carrioon.name: Carrioon
cobblemon.species.carrioon.desc: Gas builds up under its feather coat and causes it to float in the air. It sprays a foul-smelling red liquid around itself to keep hungry predators away.
cobblemon.species.embuzzle.name: Embuzzle
cobblemon.species.embuzzle.desc: They construct massive nests inside cliff faces, where their eggs are safe from danger. They are called 'janitors of the desert' because they will eat anything they come across, no matter how rotten.
cobblemon.species.scrapint.name: Scrapint
cobblemon.species.scrapint.desc: This Pokémon is very popular, but it's terrible with childrenit often ends up released into the wild by unprepared owners. When it bites, it aims for the ankles to trip opponents much larger than it.
cobblemon.species.pupnacious.name: Pupnacious
cobblemon.species.pupnacious.desc: Pupnacious are popular guard Pokémon because of their tenacity and fearsome bite. Because of its diminutive size, people tend to underestimate it and learn their mistake the hard way.
cobblemon.species.lungob.name: Lungob
cobblemon.species.lungob.desc: A missing link between Pokemon of the land and sea. It digs burrows using its mouth, spitting out the sand as a compacted mud ball. Thousands of mud balls littering a lake shore are a sign that this Pokemon is around.
cobblemon.species.dessibello.name: Dessibello
cobblemon.species.dessibello.desc: It can survive on land for long periods of time. Using its powerful lungs, this Pokemon exhales mighty gusts to clear away sand and rock, searching for underground water that it will use to hydrate itself.
cobblemon.species.chardine.name: Chardine
cobblemon.species.chardine.desc: Born survivalists, they live only in remote basins in the desert, where they can handle even the hottest of temperatures. Threats to their unique habitat have made them rare.
cobblemon.species.volray.name: Volray
cobblemon.species.volray.desc: Because it likes to hide under the sand, swimmers are warned to shuffle their feet in the water to avoid stepping on this Pokémon's electrified body.
cobblemon.species.torplitz.name: Torplitz
cobblemon.species.torplitz.desc: The rings on its body are electrical organs, emitting pulses that help it navigate even in pitch-black waters. Touching any part of its body results in a nasty electric shock.
cobblemon.species.sprouton.name: Sprouton
cobblemon.species.sprouton.desc: It thrives on soil rich in metal content, which it stores in its bulb. When it is ready to evolve, it drills deep underground and sprouts.
cobblemon.species.utopion.name: Utopion
cobblemon.species.utopion.desc: Deep within is an organic plant core, protected by several layers of metal. In desolate, polluted lands, this Pokémon will take root, slowly healing the environment.
cobblemon.species.champiant.name: Champiant
cobblemon.species.champiant.desc: Although it is small, this Pokémon is able to lift practically anything, even heavy boulders. In numbers, they can carry an entire Metagross away.
cobblemon.species.filsick.name: Filsick
cobblemon.species.filsick.desc: It's a carrier of many strange diseases. It's believed that those who it points to with its antenna will fall ill, but modern medicine has made it mostly harmless.
cobblemon.species.fevirus.name: Fevirus
cobblemon.species.fevirus.desc: Its burning blood makes it combust at the slightest provocation. Fevirus are known to explode in a fiery burst if they don't simmer down fast enough.
cobblemon.species.shivirus.name: Shivirus
cobblemon.species.shivirus.desc: It's always shuddering and sniffling, even under the warm summer sun. When it sneezes, which is often, the fluid is ejected as razor-sharp bolts of ice.
cobblemon.species.quivirus.name: Quivirus
cobblemon.species.quivirus.desc: Its stiff body often twitches profusely from the pent-up electrical energy within. When touched, it flails about for a very brief moment before freezing up again.
cobblemon.species.snole.name: Snole
cobblemon.species.snole.desc: Tunneling through snow as if it were liquid, it hunts for Sleetle hibernating deep in the soil. Its nose is always covered in frost from constantly pushing against the snow it digs through.
cobblemon.species.digloo.name: Digloo
cobblemon.species.digloo.desc: Digloo is just as at home in the water as it is in soil. Able to cut through ice with ease, it waits for something to wander onto the water's frozen surface, then strikes from below.
cobblemon.species.frosmole.name: Frosmole
cobblemon.species.frosmole.desc: Though its claws are razor-sharp and it can fire off powerful ice beams from its snout, what it's really feared for are the avalanches caused by its constant tunneling.
cobblemon.species.gavile.name: Gavile
cobblemon.species.gavile.desc: Gavile's skin is as dark as a shadow, so during the night it becomes virtually invisible. Shine a light on it, however, and it will scramble away in a panic.
cobblemon.species.chirocodile.name: Chirocodile
cobblemon.species.chirocodile.desc: Its back is so dark it seems to swallow up all light, so you may never see it clinging to the walls of its cave until it springs off and swoops at you.
cobblemon.species.erradio.name: Erradio
cobblemon.species.erradio.desc: The strange energy generated by this Pokémon causes technology to malfunction. It climbs up telephone poles to drink electricity.
cobblemon.species.disructor.name: Disructor
cobblemon.species.disructor.desc: Electricity that passes through it is amplified to extreme levels. It produces sound waves that cause disorientation, making it dangerous to aircraft.
cobblemon.species.rhinozer.name: Rhinozer
cobblemon.species.rhinozer.desc: Rhinozer travel in herds, and as they move along they create visible dirt paths. Other Pokémon learn to cross these paths with caution as they may get trampled by an oncoming herd if they aren't careful.
cobblemon.species.rhinolition.name: Rhinolition
cobblemon.species.rhinolition.desc: Its huge horn is shaped like a scoop, and as it charges forward, it bulldozes all in its path. Rhinolition are often used by construction crews due to their strength and ease of clearing land.
cobblemon.species.notifant.name: Notifant
cobblemon.species.notifant.desc: When it smells smoke with its sensitive trunk, it makes a loud, ringing call to alert other Pokemon to evacuate. Then, it douses the source of the smoke with a blast of water from its trunk.
cobblemon.species.fountusk.name: Fountusk
cobblemon.species.fountusk.desc: This Pokemon has a helpful disposition that makes it a trusted ally of people. Often, they are tasked to rescue trapped people and Pokemon by using their flexible trunks for safe retrieval.
cobblemon.species.eledrant.name: Eledrant
cobblemon.species.eledrant.desc: It can drink a whole swimming pool's worth of water, then blast it from its trunk and tusks. Herds of Eledrant easily combat the brushfires that are common in their native habitat.
cobblemon.species.hayataga.name: Hayataga
cobblemon.species.hayataga.desc: By grabbing the end of its tail, it spins around and generates electricity. The designers of an experimental all-terrain vehicle were inspired by it.
cobblemon.species.welweed.name: Welweed
cobblemon.species.welweed.desc: Feigning helplessness, it cries for sympathy, pretending to be someone trapped in the sand. Then, it suddenly uproots itself, attacking with its long, sharp-edged leaf.
cobblemon.species.welwitch.name: Welwitch
cobblemon.species.welwitch.desc: Upon evolving, its grudges from its isolation in the desert manifest as power too great to be contained. It cackles wickedly as it ensnares everything with its leaves.
cobblemon.species.vespark.name: Vespark
cobblemon.species.vespark.desc: It's said to have the most excruciatingly painful sting of any Pokémon. Because of this, nothing will challenge it for territory, not even other Vespark.
cobblemon.species.volthroe.name: Volthroe
cobblemon.species.volthroe.desc: The stinger is always surging with electricity. When two Volthroe spar for territory, the impact of their stingers clashing together creates brilliant bursts of sparks.
cobblemon.species.snooseat.name: Snooseat
cobblemon.species.snooseat.desc: From the moment of birth, it searches for a piece of old wood to live in. Once it's found a comfortable-enough object to rest on, it never leaves.
cobblemon.species.taraxaconk.name: Taraxaconk
cobblemon.species.taraxaconk.desc: Bundles of cottony spores cover its fists, cushioning them from the heavy impacts of its punches. If the force of the punch doesn't KO its target, the spores will.
cobblemon.species.phoncrawl.name: Phoncrawl
cobblemon.species.phoncrawl.desc: An early foray into communications tech that became a Pokémon. It can broadcast messages to other Phoncrawl over very long distances.
cobblemon.species.techknot.name: Techknot
cobblemon.species.techknot.desc: It was once a cutting-edge artificial Mon, but was discarded. The frayed wires at its sides crackle with so much electrical energy that it often shorts itself out.
cobblemon.species.trawlossus.name: Trawlossus
cobblemon.species.trawlossus.desc: It stretches the sticky web between its legs to catch prey that fly into it, where they are digested by toxic fluid in the silk. Its paper-thin body easily drifts away in the wind.
cobblemon.species.puppest.name: Puppest
cobblemon.species.puppest.desc: A tricky Pokémon made of cloth that seems to eat and attack only through the puppets on its arms. It is fiercely protective of its puppets and will never let go of them.
cobblemon.species.socktopus.name: Socktopus
cobblemon.species.socktopus.desc: The puppets it holds are made of psychic energy, and they divert attacks away from its soft body. If one of them gets destroyed, it simply generates a new one.
cobblemon.species.germuck.name: Germuck
cobblemon.species.germuck.desc: It was accidentally unearthed from beneath a glacier, but it's mostly harmless. It forms colonies with such exponential growth that it will exhaust all food in the area within days.
cobblemon.species.germasaur.name: Germasaur
cobblemon.species.germasaur.desc: Germasaur is made entirely of tiny Germuck packed together into a form that can be as solid or liquid as it wishes. It's so deathly afraid of cleanliness that it may hide its trainer's soap while they're asleep.
cobblemon.species.flaskantine.name: Flaskantine
cobblemon.species.flaskantine.desc: It uses freezing cold to keep the biohazardous bacteria within from growing out of control. To forcefully remove the plug from atop its head is to ensure certain demise.
cobblemon.species.flingzer.name: Flingzer
cobblemon.species.flingzer.desc: It grows spherical fruit, which it then throws with its enlarged leaf. It catches incoming projectiles with its mouth and spits them back out with twice the force.
cobblemon.species.hotdach.name: Hotdach
cobblemon.species.hotdach.desc: Its tail constantly grows in segments that fall off as they get too long, leaving behind a trail for other Hotdach to follow. A severed tail segment may continue to burn for several days.
cobblemon.species.schnausage.name: Schnausage
cobblemon.species.schnausage.desc: Its nose-flame is attuned to the quality of the surrounding air, so it burns differently when detecting certain scents. It burns the brightest in the presence of other Schnausage in the pack.
cobblemon.species.pictolith.name: Pictolith
cobblemon.species.pictolith.desc: The majority of its body is animated by the living paint on its face. If a Pictolith is washed clean, it stops moving entirely.
cobblemon.species.canvalith.name: Canvalith
cobblemon.species.canvalith.desc: This Pokemon allows people to paint on its body because it feeds on the materials in the paint. Eventually, the paint is absorbed and it becomes a blank canvas again.
cobblemon.species.sinklot.name: Sinklot
cobblemon.species.sinklot.desc: This Pokemon makes its home inside of pipes, causing them to become clogged. Its fur is slick and oily to help it move through tight spaces.
cobblemon.species.snareball.name: Snareball
cobblemon.species.snareball.desc: Snareball's fur is extremely coarse and abrasive, like steel wool. It is a welcome sight at sewage treatment plants because it filters out toxic garbage from the water with its fur.
cobblemon.species.whaxzza.name: Whaxzza
cobblemon.species.whaxzza.desc: Whaxzza is covered in an incredibly hot wax that it can control the solidity ofit can be as solid or liquid as the situation requires. Its flame produces a sweet scent that carries for miles.
cobblemon.species.beatzza.name: Beatzza
cobblemon.species.beatzza.desc: It picks berries constantlynot to eat, but to wear on its head. The most extravagantly decorated Beatzza becomes the leader of the pack.
cobblemon.species.manchinade.name: Manchinade
cobblemon.species.manchinade.desc: Its leaves act as a limiter that keeps the energy within from overflowing. If it loses them in a fight, it explodes, sending sharp seeds flying in all directions.
cobblemon.species.mandrazooka.name: Mandrazooka
cobblemon.species.mandrazooka.desc: It grabs Manchinade and spits them out at high speeds to ward off enemies from its territory. Intense heat and toxic gases emanate from its bodyparking a car near one will melt the paint right off.
cobblemon.species.buoybie.name: Buoybie
cobblemon.species.buoybie.desc: A bird Pokémon that can neither fly nor swim very well, so it relies on its parents to guide it along. Its feathers are buoyant enough to keep it afloat without needing to tread water, but it can't dive and is often helpless if left unattended.
cobblemon.species.albalue.name: Albalue
cobblemon.species.albalue.desc: Albalue are masters of the sky and sea, able to maneuver through water as swiftly as in the air. However, they're so adapted to this lifestyle that their walking skills leave something to be desired.
cobblemon.species.soponge.name: Soponge
cobblemon.species.soponge.desc: Its porous body can swell to four times its original size by taking in water. It can violently expel this stored water from the tubes on its head.
cobblemon.species.bubbaluffa.name: Bubbaluffa
cobblemon.species.bubbaluffa.desc: Despite its boneless, absorbent body, it has a very tough, rigid texture, and remarkable resistance to pain. Enough of them lined up on a beach could soak up an entire tsunami.
cobblemon.species.anemeany.name: Anemeany
cobblemon.species.anemeany.desc: It gathers in swarms by the water's edge, attacking intruders by stretching out and flailing itself like a club. The colony pushes away boats that try to sail over their land.
cobblemon.species.truculony.name: Truculony
cobblemon.species.truculony.desc: It's so territorial that it will not rest until it has scared off all other Pokémon from its habitat. Colonies of this Pokémon will enter blood feuds that last for generations.
cobblemon.species.lusigusi.name: Lusigusi
cobblemon.species.lusigusi.desc: It perches on rocks with its sucker-foot. It's often mistaken for a bird Pokémon from a distance, but it's only shaped like one; it can't even fly.
cobblemon.species.hermice.name: Hermice
cobblemon.species.hermice.desc: Water vapor in the air around it condenses and freezes into its shell of ice. It must shed this ice daily or risk its whole body fatally freezing over.
cobblemon.species.hermafrost.name: Hermafrost
cobblemon.species.hermafrost.desc: Its icy shell makes it float on the water's surface, which is where it hunts. Its blood temperature is always cold enough to prevent its shell from melting.
cobblemon.species.hagma.name: Hagma
cobblemon.species.hagma.desc: Its body is coated in super-flammable slime that ignites easily. Holding onto this Pokémon is difficult because the slippery slime allows it to wriggle through even the tightest grip.
cobblemon.species.conhagrant.name: Conhagrant
cobblemon.species.conhagrant.desc: It shoots hot slime from its mouth like a cannon to blast apart its food. This slime is hot and corrosive enough to bore through a sunken ship with ease.
cobblemon.species.mesmarine.name: Mesmarine
cobblemon.species.mesmarine.desc: Mesmarine slowly creep across the seafloor collecting minerals from the sand. They use these to form their disorientingly sparkly shells, which are tough enough to resist the battering of waves which would sweep away most other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.jellop.name: Jellop
cobblemon.species.jellop.desc: Underneath its rubbery head are thin tentacles that can stretch up to a mile long. Get stung by one and you'll be wracked with pain for days.
cobblemon.species.irukarate.name: Irukarate
cobblemon.species.irukarate.desc: Irukarate makes up for its lack of physical strength with its sheer agility, able to dodge an opponent's attack and incapacitate it with a swift pinch in the back of the neck.
cobblemon.species.craberrant.name: Craberrant
cobblemon.species.craberrant.desc: A temperamental Pokémon that emerges from the sea at night, or if disturbed by offshore human activity. Its hard shell is highly resistant to undersea pressures but is also very flexible.
cobblemon.species.frogfew.name: Frogfew
cobblemon.species.frogfew.desc: Frogfew lays flat on the ground in swampy riverbanks, covered in mud and leaf litter except for its sweet-smelling lure. Its sticky body is sometimes stepped upon by unwary creatures too big to be prey, and so it ends up tracked along and somewhat irritated by the whole experience.
cobblemon.species.sundangler.name: Sundangler
cobblemon.species.sundangler.desc: Floating on the water's surface, the flowery tree on its back might look safe to rest under, but its entire body is as sticky as flypaper. Bird Pokémon will roost on top of it and find themselves unable to fly away as it submerges to drown them.
cobblemon.species.psyder.name: Psyder
cobblemon.species.psyder.desc: It spins its web in a spiral pattern, then twirls it around in a disorienting fashion. It is usually most active under the light of the full moon.
cobblemon.species.lunarach.name: Lunarach
cobblemon.species.lunarach.desc: It can manifest a nearly-invisible psychic web between its two horns to catch flying prey, then balls them up in silk and snacks on them.
cobblemon.species.rotpot.name: Rotpot
